description: Have some Easter baking fun with this Easter egg brookies recipe. These gooey, chocolate- and caramel-filled brownie cookies are sure to delight.
name: Easter Bunny Scrolls Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 2 cups White Wings Plain Flour, plus extra for dusting

recipeInstructions.text: Combine milk, yeast and 1/2 tsp caster sugar in a small bowl. Stand for 5 minutes or until frothy. Add 75g butter and half of the egg, then whisk to combine. Combine flour and 1 tbs caster sugar in a large bowl. Add milk mixture and stir until a wet dough forms. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead for 8 minutes or until smooth and elastic. Place in a large greased bowl and cover. Stand in a warm place for 1 hour to prove.
Meanwhile, combine cinnamon, and remaining caster sugar and butter in a small bowl.

Preheat oven to 200 ̊C/180 ̊C fan-forced. Line 2 large baking trays with baking paper. Punch dough down. Roll dough out between 2 sheets of baking paper to form a 30 x 40cm rectangle. Spread cinnamon mixture over dough. Cut a 10 x 40cm rectangle from dough, then cut smaller rectangle crossways into 20 x 2cm-wide strips. Set aside.

Starting with 1 long side of large rectangle, tightly roll dough to enclose filling. Refrigerate for 15 minutes or until firm. Using a serrated knife, evenly slice into 10 pieces Arrange scrolls on trays. Using picture as a guide, arrange 2 dough strips on each scroll to form ears, pinching firmly to attach. Press down scroll to level with ears. Brush bunnies with remaining egg. Loosely cover with a clean tea towel and set aside in a warm place for 30 minutes to prove.

Bake bunnies for 18 minutes or until golden. Stand for 10 minutes to cool slightly. Combine icing sugar and 1 tbs water in a small bowl. Drizzle bunnies with glaze, then decorate with yellow Smarties to form eyes and pink Smarties to form a nose. Set aside for 15 minutes to set. Serve.
